comments.author: HDCommentary

top_comment.text: its cool, could i carry silver 2 games with him?﻿
top_comment.author: Gragas guy

comments.text:
no problem, just let the kills come to you, low elo players tend to be way 
more aggressive than they should be and tunnel hard on trying to get a 
kill, soon you will find this to be free kills with little effort needed. 
Just be patient and work on your CS'ing and mechanics. I would also 
recommend you pick like 3 champions to main and just spam them. You will 
get better....just takes time thats all.
comments.author: Tory Kauth

comments.text: thanks
comments.author: Gragas guy

comments.text:
Bronze and Silver games can be easily carried with just about ANY champion 
so long as you play well. In most cases just focus mainly on farming and 
wait for the enemy laner to make a mistake (which happens ALOT in bronze 
and Silver) for those low elo games all you need to do is learn to 
capitalize on mistakes and proper positioning. Doesnt matter what champ you 
play I promise you will succeed if you follow those basic steps. Get better 
at CS'ing and Capitalize on the many many mistakes the enemy makes, like 
when they attack you in your minion wave, stay in lane on low hp, play 
agressive with very low mana, over extend with no wards or means of escape 
i.e. flash on cd.
Hope that helps :)
comments.author: Tory Kauth

comments.text: Easy
comments.author: HDCommentary

top_comment.text:
Can someone please explain in depth of why I should press W before ulting? 
The video didn't explain too clearly.﻿
top_comment.author: Scroll Studios

comments.text: +HDCommentary Wow, I didn't know that. Thanks a bunch!
comments.author: Scroll Studios

comments.text:
I did explain it. When you W on a target and you deal damage to that same 
target after that, Lucian gets additional movement speed. This also applies 
when you hit your ultimate, so it's easier to hit your ultimate thanks to 
the movement speed you get.
comments.author: HDCommentary

top_comment.text:

ult to proc the w passive it will speed you up﻿

captions.text:
Lucian Guide
--

- Hello there and welcome to yet another Season
4 guide. In this guide I'll be teaching you
how to play Lucian. Have fun!
-- intro clip --

- Lucian is an insanely strong AD carry when
played correctly. I've been playing him only

for a certain amount of time to figure out
what he is capable of. Turns out that lucian

is able to deal almost the most amount of
damage of any ADC, and therefore I decided
to make this guide.

- If you want to know anything about runes,
masteries and item builds, please take a look

at the description. I don't want to talk about
that in this video because it's a ton of boring
information that can just be copied.

- Before we start going in-depth on the laning
phase and teamfighting phase, let's take a
quick look at Lucian his skillset.

- His passive, Lightslinger, gives lucian
a rapid-fire double shot after using a skill.

This is primarily what makes Lucian such a
strong AD

carry. To make good use of this passive, use
a skill, double shot someone and use a skill

again. Don't use 2 skills after eachother,
because that would waste a bunch of damage.

- His Q, Piercing Light, shoots a lazer towards
the direction of the clicked target. This

skill must be clicked on an enemy unit. It
deals damage
to all enemies hit.

- His W, Adent Blaze, shoots a projectile
towards a position. When it hits either something

inbetween or it hits its destination, the
projectile

will explode dealing area of effect damage.
All hit targets are marked with a passive

which makes Lucian run faster when he auto
attacks
them.

- His E, Relentless Pursuit, dashes lucian
towards a position. This skill allows lucian

to reposition himself and to pass through
walls.

- His R, The Culling, makes Lucian shoot rapidly
into 1 direction. This skill takes a certain

amount of time and allows Lucian to reposition
himself during cast time. However, Lucian

is not able to change the direction of the
skill. The skill shoots faster when you have

more attack
speed. When you get a kill during its duration,

your E's cooldown will reset, allowing you
to dash again.

- Alright, having done that, it is now time
to go more in-depth on the laning phase and
the teamfighting phase.

- Lucian is a beast on lane because he usually
out-trades any other ADC in the game. His

double shot passive allows for great damage
trades

and for lane domination. Use this effectively
on lane.

- Position yourself in a way that you are
in a line with your enemies. This way, you

can use your Q to harass enemies through minions.
It

deals quite some damage and because its range
is relatively long, you won't be damaged back.

- Be careful with your mana usage on lane.
I see a lot of unskilled Lucians spam their

spells on minions on lane, which is really
not the way

to go. His skills take quite a lot of mana
and all of your damage is dependant on using

your skills effectively. Use your skills only
to

damage enemy champions and use your double
shot after them.

- On level 6 you can deal some serious damage
on your targets, because a good ult can deal

almost 50% of someones HP in damage. Before
casting

your ult, hit your targets with your W. This
will give you a speed buff when you hit your

ult, allowing you to hit your ult easier.
You can

also use your E to reposition yourself in
your ultimate. If you get a kill, you can

use your E again to dash either back or to
chase others.

- If you are on lane and you want to push
a wave in before you go back, it's possible

to use your ult to do that. It has increased
damage onto

minions, so 1 ultimate usually kills the entire
minion wave. Also, when you're pushing turrets,

you can use your skills to get your double
shot,
thus killing the tower faster.

- If you're starting to get the feel with
Lucian, you'll figure out that you can all-in

on everyone in order to get a kill. This is
risky though

because it's still dependant on how your support
plays. With all-ins on lane it's important

that you have synergy with your support, that
he

uses his summoners correctly and reacts properly
to your all in.

- Teamfights are not much different from the
lane, to be honest. The only thing that I

like to do is to use your ultimate to kill
tanks. If you

have your Last Whisperer, this DESTROYS tanks.
You can also use it to long-range poke when

you're sieging turrets. This usually makes
them too
low to defend their turret.

- Just make sure that you use his double shot
to full effect. This makes Lucian so strong.

Use skill, double shot, use skill, doubleshot,
and so on.

If you've got that under controll and you
know standard AD carry rules, like staying

in the back and kiting, you should be able
to dominate in
games.

- If you have any questions concerning Lucian,
feel free to comment below. I will try to
answer all your questions.

- Thank you for watching this HDCommentary.
If you've liked the video, please press the

Like button below. This helps me with growing
my YouTube Channel.

If you've enjoyed the video and you want to
see more of these, feel free to subscribe

to my channel. Now get into a game with Lucian
and kick some ass!

title: Lucian Guide Season 5 - How to Play & How to Carry like Doublelift and Piglet! - League of Legends
